location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'MAP 23 MAP TO ILLUSTRATE OPERATIONS AGAINST THE HAI SALIENT AND THE DAHRA BEND POSITIONS, AND THE PASSAGE OF THE TIGRIS: 11TH. JANUARY-24TH. FEBRUARY, 1917.'

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: Printed in colour on paperDimensions: 230 x 272mm, on sheet 292 x 335mm

mods.abstract: The map accompanies The Campaign in Mesopotamia 1914-1918. Volume III, and shows a stretch of the River Tigris and surrounding region to the west of Kut in central and eastern Iraq, indicating military positions, trenches, settlements and watercourses. A note in the lower left qualifies the accuracy of the map in relation to trenches.Prepared in the Historical Section of the Committee of Imperial Defence, and printed at the Ordnance Survey in 1925.
